content.content: About 270,000 people die from sepsis each year in the United States.[^85] That is equal to one person dying every 2 minutes. About 87% of sepsis cases begin outside of the hospital.[^85] Sepsis kills more people than breast cancer, prostate cancer and AIDS combined[^86] Sepsis is the body's extreme and life-threatening overreaction to an infection. The body attacks itself and can cause tissue damage, organ failure, amputations and death.[^86] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/7f_FxKGEk4E ### Questions to Ask: - Does the patient have a fast heart rate? - Is the patient breathing fast? - Does the patient have a very low blood pressure? - Does the patient have a fever or low body temperature? - Is the patient's skin pale or discolored? - Does the patient have extreme pain? - Is the patient sleepy, confused or difficult to wake? - Is there an increase or decrease in white blood cells?[^86] Embedded content: http://youtu.be/sGXGGMloKFA __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__ [The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form") [Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance") Embedded content: https://youtu.be/cypQFXPrQD4 ## Post-Sepsis Syndrome (PSS) Embedded content: https://youtu.be/HIk64wdy44Q __Fifty percent (50%) of Sepsis survivors suffer from Post-Sepsis Syndrome.__[^87] ### New Physical Challenges: - Fatigue and weakness - Muscle &/or joint pain - Amputation - Increased risk for infection - Shortness of breath - Dressing, grooming, walking, & feeding difficulties[^87],[^88] ### New Mental Issues: - Depression, anxiety, &/or PTSD (Post-traumatic stress syndrome) - Poor memory or slow thinking - Difficulty concentrating - Difficulty sleeping, nightmares, &/or insomnia - Panic attacks - Hallucinations[^87],[^88] ### Prevention: - Early mobilization - [ICU Diary](http://www.icu-diary.org/diary/Diary.html "ICU Diary") - Family/Caregiver support and engagement[^89],[^90] ### Treatments & Support: - Physical, Occupational, &/or Speech therapy - Psychological therapy, counseling, &/or neuropsychological testing - Follow up health care provider &/or specialist appointments - Medication review & education by health care provider[^89],[^90] [Sepsis Alliance](https://www.sepsis.org/ "Sepsis Alliance") [End Sepsis](https://www.endsepsis.org/ "End Sepsis") [Post-Sepsis Syndrome](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/ "Post-Sepsis Syndrome") [^85]: Heron M. Deaths: Leading causes for 2016. National Vital Statistics Reports; vol 67 no 6. Hyattsville, MD: National Center for Health Statistics. 2018. Accessed September 27, 2018. [^86]: The Rory Staunton Foundation. Sepsis fact sheet. [Sepsis Fact Sheet](https://rorystauntonfoundationforsepsis.org/sepsis-fact-sheet/ "Sepsis Fact Sheet") Accessed May 20, 2020. [^87]: Sepsis Alliance. Post-Sepsis Syndrome. Accessed March 8, 2020. [https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/) [^88]: Prescott HC, Angus DC. Postsepsis morbidity. *JAMA.* 2018;319(1):91. doi:10.1001/jama.2017.19809.[https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2667724](https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2667724) Accessed March 8, 2020." [^89]: Parker AM, Sricharoenchai T, & Needham DM. Early rehabilitation in the intensive care unit: Preventing impairment of physical and mental health. Curr Phys Med Rehabil Rep 1, 307–314 (2013). Accessed April 10, 2020. https://doi.org/10.1007/s40141-013-0027-9. [^90]: Davidson JE, Aslakson RA, Long AC, Puntillo KA, Kross EK, Hart J, et al. .
